name: F. Present to Mom
statement:
How many stars are there in the sky? A young programmer Polycarpus can’t
get this question out of his head! He took a photo of the starry sky
using his digital camera and now he analyzes the resulting monochrome
digital picture. The picture is represented by a rectangular matrix
consisting of lines each containing characters. A character equals ”, if
the corresponding photo pixel is white and ”, if it is black.Polycarpus
thinks that he has found a star on the photo if he finds a white pixel
surrounded by four side-neighboring pixels that are also white: 1 111 1
Polycarpus whats to cut out a rectangular area from the photo and give
his mom as a present. This area should contain no less than stars. The
stars can intersect, have shared white pixels on the photo. The boy will
cut out the rectangular area so that its borders will be parallel to the
sides of the photo and the cuts will go straight between the pixel
borders.Now Polycarpus keeps wondering how many ways there are to cut an
area out of the photo so that it met the conditions given above. Help
Polycarpus find this number.
